item.title: File operations
item.description: Pre-filing We’ll see some simple one line examples on operations on files themselves without modifying contents. We’ll just use standard Java classes. To run these commands make sure you have installed j’bang and then at your terminal do: jbang -i https://shadowmanos.github.io/tutorials/processingfiles/fileOperations.jsh List folders and files First step is always to create a Path that represents a path to a file or folder, and in many ways supersedes the older File class.

item.title: File Processing
item.description: Use Java to programmatically and interactively manage and modify files and folders. Unbeknownst to outsiders, this is a big part of data science work! Tutorials Operations on files

item.title: Natural Language Processing
item.description: Use Java to programmatically analyse the grammar of plain English text i.e. Natural Language Processing or programmatically create text in English i.e. Natural Language Generation or classify various pieces of text according to some criteria i.e. Text Categorisation. All text samples used here are Star Trek quotes (in English, not Klingon) sourced from either Wikipedia or Memory Alpha. After an entirely unscientific thought process, I decided such quotes are grammatically correct, adequately diverse and of average complexity.

item.title: Play with Stanford CoreNLP's Simple API
item.description: Core what now? CoreNLP is a Natural Language Processing library written in Java by some lovely people at Stanford University and available under a GPL or commercial license.
